dcterms:creator: S. Suman
A. Etemad
F. Rivest
dcterms:description: A dataset used to simulate a series of experiments with a Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning based human model capable of learning activities and setting its thermal preferences in a smart home environment.
dcterms:title: Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning based human model

dcterms:creator: S. ASHRAE
dcterms:description: A model that uses thermal data from a large number of participants to approximate human thermal comfort with a mean vote.
dcterms:title: Model presented in [1] that uses thermal data from a large number of participants

dcterms:creator: F. Salamone
L. Belussi
C. Currò
L. Danza
M. Ghellere
G. Guazzi
B. Lenzi
V. Megale
I. Meroni
dcterms:description: A dataset containing Electrodermal Activity, humidity, operational skin temperature, and heart rate used to classify users' thermal comfort perception.
dcterms:title: Electrodermal Activity, humidity, operational skin temperature, and heart rate

dcterms:creator: K. Katić
R. Li
W. Zeiler
dcterms:description: A dataset that includes skin temperatures and occupants’ heating behavior used to predict personal overall thermal comfort.
dcterms:title: Skin temperatures and occupants’ heating behavior

dcterms:creator: J. Kim
Y. Zhou
S. Schiavon
P. Raftery
G. Brager
dcterms:description: A dataset for personal comfort models that predict individuals’ thermal preference using occupant heating and cooling behavior.
dcterms:title: Personal comfort models using occupant heating and cooling behavior

dcterms:creator: C. Gebhardt
A. Oulasvirta
O. Hilliges
dcterms:description: A human thermal comfort model based on hierarchical reinforcement learning as a model of human task interleaving.
dcterms:title: Human thermal comfort model

dcterms:creator: S. Liu
dcterms:description: A dataset for personal thermal comfort models based on physiological parameters measured by wearable sensors.
dcterms:title: Personal thermal comfort models based on physiological parameters measured by wearable sensors
